senses.sense_definition: A social group of people, often sharing a common ancestry, language, and culture, typically living in a distinct territory and having a recognized leader.

examples.text: The nomadic <w>tribe</w> moved across the desert with the changing seasons.
Anthropologists studied the customs and rituals of the remote <w>tribe</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A group of people who share the same interests, profession, or lifestyle, often feeling a strong sense of belonging together.

examples.text: She finally felt like she found her <w>tribe</w> when she joined the local art club.
In the world of fashion, he was well known among his <w>tribe</w> of designers and models.

senses.sense_definition: A scientific category for classifying living things, ranking between a family and a genus.

examples.text: This specific plant belongs to a <w>tribe</w> that is mostly found in tropical regions.
Biologists categorize these insects into a distinct <w>tribe</w> based on their wing structure.

senses.sense_definition: To categorize or divide people or things into groups or classes.

examples.text: The ancient historian <w>tribed</w> the population according to their origin.
In his book, the animals were <w>tribed</w> by their habitat rather than their species.
We have an appointment with Mr. <w>Tribe</w> at three o'clock.
Emily <w>Tribe</w> is the author of several historical novels.
